channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: EU would 'be delighted' to forge closer ties with the U.K.'s next government, according to Economy Commissioner
item.description: While Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has edged the U.K. closer to the EU and helped normalize relations with the bloc, Labour has vowed to further improve ties if it wins.

item.title: Some employers are reluctant to hire college grads who attended pro-Palestinian protests: Survey
item.description: Some employers are reluctant to hire college grads who attended recent pro-Palestinian protests over fears they are liabilities, an Intelligent.com survey found.

item.title: GameStop shares soar on completion of $933 million stock sale after meme frenzy
Women are now less likely to be in top earning 1% of U.K. finance and professional services jobs than before the pandemic
item.description: There's been progress, but the more senior you get, the greater the gender gap.

item.title: Meet the art collectors with home galleries: 'The stock market doesn't give me any fulfillment'
item.description: Christian Levett opens his home for tours of his collection, while Grant Cardone prefers art to the stock market. The Boros family live above their art museum.

item.title: Buoyed by Nvidia earnings, Wall Street holds hope for a 'Goldilocks scenario'
Here's how ADHD is diagnosed in adults
item.description: The disorder can present differently in children and adults.

item.title: Here are the top 10 most desirable cities for expats looking to relocate in 2024
item.description: London maintained its top spot as the most desirable destination city for global talent, according to the Decoding Global Talent 2024 report.

item.title: How Morgan Spurlock and ‘Super Size Me’ changed our view of fast food
'Bond King' Bill Gross warns Trump would worsen deficits and be 'more disruptive' for the bond market than Biden
item.description: "Trump is the more bearish of the candidates simply because his programs advocate continued tax cuts and more expensive things."

item.title: Climate change behind increasing flight turbulence, Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg says
item.description: Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg says an increase in flight turbulence is an effect of climate change.

item.title: Nasdaq leads U.S. stocks higher Friday, though Dow snaps 5-week win streak
A flood of cheap Chinese exports is putting the entire global economy at risk, France’s finance minister warns
item.description: “We have an issue with the economic model in which China is producing more and more cheaper industrial devices because it could be a threat not only for the EU, not only for the US, but for the global world economy.”

item.title: Here's what adding Nvidia would mean for the 128-year-old Dow Industrial Average
item.description: The Dow, made up of 30 stocks, is a price-weighted average, meaning that higher-priced stocks cause the index to move more than a lower-priced one.

item.title: Housing has raised the cost of living — but higher rates aren’t the culprit
